title: `artifacts.require` dependency of dependency bug

body:
So, the reason that the problem doesn't go away when you delete the interface and recompile is that Truffle doesn't currently delete artifacts of removed contracts upon a recompile; there's actually an open issue for this (#2724).

However, that leaves the question of why there's a problem in the first place.  That will still need to be investigated.

Hey @S0AndS0, thanks for providing such detailed steps for reproducing this! However, when I follow your steps all of the tests that fall under "Contract: test/examples/Account.sol" and "Contract: test/examples/Host.sol" fail. So I am unable to reproduce the error you are reporting. Do you have time to advise me?

Hi @S0AndS0, this is a long shot, but I wonder if your file system mount options might contribute to this issue. Could you share your `/etc/fstab` contents, or run the cat command below to remove comments and potentially identifying information? 

I'm wondering if you've got default mount settings or something unique. Mine, below, is the default for the distro I'm using.

```shell
$ cat /etc/fstab | sed '/^#/d' | sed '/^[[:space:]]*$/d'
```

<details><summary>My distro default /etc/fstab</summary>

```console
UUID=acc3c2a5-e116-4c11-a667-4ba878d6fe22  /  ext4  discard,noatime,errors=remount-ro  0  1
UUID=0C02-D876  /boot/efi  vfat  umask=0077  0  1
UUID=35b1abcf-45a1-47e4-81df-c1e87d8f660d  none  swap  sw  0  0
```

</details>

@haltman-at Thank you!  The number of times stale artifacts have caused odd bugs is, at this point, uncountable; so ya have saved me considerable time over these intervening months.

---

@eggplantzzz I'm a bit short on time, but my guess is maybe ya need to checkout the tagged version from the OP, eg.

```bash
git checkout v0.0.1
```

... But that is just a wild guess, as it has been many moons between posting and now.

---

@cds-amal Sure!  However please be aware my device has gone through _some_ changes.

```bash
grep -Ev '^#|^\s*$' /etc/fstab
#> UUID=<UUID>                 /boot/efi      vfat  umask=0077                 0 2
#> UUID=<UUID>                 /              ext4  defaults,noatime           0 1
#> tmpfs                       /var/cache     tmpfs defaults,noatime           0 0
#> tmpfs                       /var/log       tmpfs defaults,noatime,mode=0755 0 0
#> tmpfs                       /var/spool     tmpfs defaults,noatime           0 0
#> tmpfs                       /var/tmp       tmpfs defaults,noatime           0 0
#> tmpfs                       /tmp           tmpfs defaults,noatime           0 0
```
I actually checked out that branch to do my tests according to the instructions. Unfortunately I don't think it runs :(
@S0AndS0, do you have a working reproduction guide/repo? The above instructions didn't run.
Closing for issue maintenance. @S0AndS0 Please comment if this is still a problem.
